metadata.name: Zepzelca 5 mg 1mL Injection powder lyophilized for solution

clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Lurbinectedin is indicated for the treatment of adult patients with metastatic small cell lung cancer SCLC with disease progression on or after platinum based chemotherapy L14327

contraindications.disease: Data regarding overdosage with lurbinectedin are not available Symptoms of overdose are likely to be consistent with lurbinectedin s adverse effect profile L14327
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Lurbinectedin exerts its chemotherapeutic activity by covalently binding to DNA resulting in double strand DNA breaks and subsequent cell death A214310 Lurbinectedin has been associated with myelosuppression and patients receiving therapy with this agent should be closely monitored for evidence of cytopenias Prior to beginning therapy ensure baseline neutrophil counts are 1 500 cells mm sup 3 sup and platelet counts are 100 000 mm sup 3 sup L14327 The supplementary use of granulocyte colony stimulating factor G CSF should be considered if the neutrophil count falls below 500 cells mm sup 3 sup L14327 Lurbinectedin has also been associated with hepatotoxicity L14327 Monitor liver function tests at baseline and regular intervals throughout therapy and consider holding reducing or permanently discontinuing therapy based on the severity of observed hepatotoxicity L14327
